content.statement: vascular:lymphatic:lymph-005-meige is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Lymphatic that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:lymphatic:lymph-005-meige helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:lymphatic:lymph-005-meige include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:lymphatic:lymph-005-meige.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

epidemiology.prevalence: Most common primary lymphedema (80% of cases)
epidemiology.inheritance: Usually sporadic; familial cases (Meige) are autosomal dominant

presentation.location: Lower extremities, often unilateral initially becoming bilateral
presentation.characteristics: Non-pitting initially, stems toe sign positive

genetics.other: Many cases have no identified genetic cause

diagnosis.clinical: Age of onset 1-35, exclude secondary causes
diagnosis.MRI: MR lymphangiography can visualize hypoplastic vessels
diagnosis.genetic: Testing for FOXC2, GJC2 in familial cases

associated_features.lymphedema_distichiasis: FOXC2 mutation: distichiasis (extra eyelashes), varicose veins, ptosis
associated_features.yellow_nail_syndrome: Lymphedema, pleural effusions, yellow dystrophic nails

management.conservative: Complete decongestive therapy, compression, skin care
management.surgical: Lymphovenous anastomosis, vascularized lymph node transfer in select cases
management.prevention: Cellulitis prevention critical - patient education on skin care

definition.@value: Primary lymphedema with onset between ages 1-35, typically around puberty, characterized by hypoplastic lymphatics and female predominance, representing the most common form of primary lymphedema.

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Define lymphedema praecox and distinguish from other primary lymphedemas
Recognize the female predominance and pubertal onset pattern
Understand the importance of cellulitis prevention
clinical_pearls: Lymphedema praecox is the MOST COMMON primary lymphedema (80% of cases)
4:1 female predominance - hormonal factors may play a role
Look for distichiasis (extra eyelashes) - indicates FOXC2 mutation
Unlike Milroy, cellulitis is a SIGNIFICANT risk - emphasize skin care
Stemmer sign (inability to pinch dorsal toe skin fold) is characteristic
